name: I/O Extended 2017 Mbale
description:
Google I/O is an annual developer festival held at the outdoor Shoreline Amphitheatre.

I/O Extended events bring local developer communities together to experience the I/O keynote and sessions with one another around the globe. It will also offer unique activities such as speaker sessions, codelabs, and demos.

name: GDG DevFest 17 Eastern Uganda.
description:
GDG DevFest 2017 is the biggest Google technology conference in Eastern Uganda, and is organized and run by three Google Developer Groups: GDG Jinja, GDG Mbale and GDG Busitema. 

Expect to interact with experienced Mobile and web app developers, offering you firsthand experiences in codelabs and speaker sessions across multiple product areas including Android, Firebase, cloud, IoT , etc. As GDG Mbale, we will be joining our sister GDGs in Jinja come 07 Oct 2017 at Mother Kevin Conference Centerin Jinja.

We will move as a group to Jinja like we did go to Busitema in 2016

 Please register using this form and endevour to indicate GDG Mbale as your GDG from the list on the form.

We will follow up with those who would have applied with details on transport and other logistics. You can not afford to miss this.

Please check the event website (http://devfestugandaeastern.ug/) for updates on speakers, sessions and agenda.

name: Learn Google Cloud at Google Cloud Study Jams Mbale 2018
description:
• What we'll do
Want to get started on the Google Cloud, but don't know where to begin?
This is your opportunity to start the year in style and with deep hands on knowledge.

Join us for our Cloud Study Jam! Together we'll work through three Google Cloud Platform Essentials labs, then you will get free access to the next quest so you can finish this series of labs at home to get a Google-hosted badge for your online profile. You will be able to get hands-on experience with Docker, Kubernetes and Scientific Data Processing, which will earn you additional badges.
Join this meetup to get official Google training, a $70+ value, free of charge.

• What to bring
Come with your own Laptop(PC, Mac, Chrome book)

• Important to know

Only those willing to learn and ready finish the study jam are encouraged to apply. The sessions are hands on experience and easy to follow through.

There will be three in person sessions once a week, you are expected to use the time between the sessions to further your learning, interact with fellow study jam folks and facilitators online or otherwise such that you register good progress and earn your self an online badge as symbol of your excellent knowledge and practical skills on Google Cloud:

Docker, Kubernetes and Scientific Data Processing and many more.

RSVP now as you wait for more information to come your way, we will send out an email with more details to ensure you are really ready and if not we pass the spot to the next person.
how_to_find_us: Hansu Mobile Innovations is located at Mission (Namakwekwe) Opposite Taata Kids and Sukali.

name: IWD Women TechMakers' Mbale 2018
description:
• What we'll do
We are proud to be hosting the 2018 International Women's Day Celebration, a women's tech conference. This event will highlight the stories of our growing female community of designers, developers, and technology entrepreneurs.
We plan to join the global celebrations by improving our programs while calling for greater equality in the technology gender gap within our communities thus increasing the number of women in our community through increased collaboration and awareness through social media. Our theme of IWD18 is " BUILDING A NEW HORIZON".

• What to bring
Carry your laptop and charger

• Important to know
We strives to cultivate a wholly inclusive workplace around the globe. A key component of that vision is empowering women to pursue their dreams and build tools that change the world.
Women Techmakers is lead by a global team of Googlers who are passionate about empowering women in technology through increased visibility, community, and resources.
Those who are ready to learn are welcome to apply for the event.
People of all genders are welcome to attend our event.

RSVP now as you wait for more information to come your way, we will send out an email with more details
how_to_find_us: Republic Street, Masaba Complex next to URA Offices

name: Machine Learning Study Jam and TensorFlow Dev Summit Extended 2018
description:
New to Machine Learning but don’t know where to start? Join us for a Machine Learning Study Jam where we will run through the Machine Learning Crash Course (MLCC)!

This free course is intended for those who wish to learn about ML from a practical, applied perspective that will enable you to use machine learning in your everyday projects and learn about the power of TensorFlow.
This is a great opportunity for anyone with basic technical knowledge and limited Machine Learning knowledge willing to gain some practical experience in ML and TensorFlow.

GDG Mbale is proud to be hosting this MLCC sponsored by Google, yes you read Google, it is Free come and learn

We will have several meetups from which study jammers will accomplish several lessons which will bring them from zero to almost hero at Machine Learning using TensorFlow APIs.
We will have certificates for those who complete the course with in four weeks.

name: Google I/O 2018 Extended Mbale
description:
Google I/O is an annual developer festival held at the outdoor Shoreline Amphitheatre.
I/O Extended events bring local developer communities together to experience the I/O keynote and sessions with one another around the globe. It will also offer unique activities such as speaker sessions, code labs, and demos.

This event is intended to bring members up to speed with with Google IO proceedings. It is also intended to give a platform for developers to update their developer knowledge and skills through code labs and sessions that will be available after Google IO.
how_to_find_us: Hiltop View Hotel is located adjustment to URA (Mbale)

name: Next '18 Extended Mbale
description:
Next'18 Extended Mbale will bring together developers around the Mbale to take part in the Next'18 experience after the main conference.

Hands-on-code labs (Qwiklabs)
Demos
Speaker sessions
Streams from relevant keynotes and sessions.

Remember to:
Keep time,the event starts at exactly the stated time
Bring a laptop + charger
Create a Qwiklabs account at google.qwiklabs.com/users/sign_up
Make sure you check the opt-in box for promos! That makes you eligible for additional free access after completing the first series of labs.
how_to_find_us: Republic Street, Masaba Complex next to URA offices.

name: Flutter Study Jam'18 Mbale
description:
Flutter study jams are a series of meetups where we guide a group of learners on how to use Flutter to develop high-quality, interactive mobile applications for iOS and Android devices.
Work with instructors step-by-step to build a fully functional native “Unit Converter App” for both iOS and Android using Flutter
Learn how to set up your environment and start building your first Flutter application
Learn about fundamentals: UI Widgets, App State, Material Design, User Interaction and Gestures, and Packages
Learn how to structure and architect your app and use Flutter's tooling to build apps efficiently
Complete the course and get Google-offered Study Jam completion certificate and a profile badge.

name: DevFest Mbale (Eastern Uganda) 2018
description:
DevFest Mbale (Eastern Uganda) 2018 is our annual all-day developer conference that offers speaker sessions, code labs and workshops across multiple areas like Cloud, Web, Mobile, Machine Inteligience, local demos of awesome solutiions and more!
This is meant to prepare developers in the region with knowledge and skill on how they will build for the next Billion users as way of fighting unemployment affecting youths who make over 70% of Uganda’s population and are jobless. It is an all day event hosted by GDG Mbale

Expect more insights specific ares like: Google Cloud, Firebase, Android, TensorFlow, Flutter, Google Assistant, codelabs to name but a few.

Theme: "Developing for a digital wellbeing and fighting unemployment through technology and innovation"

Goal

To equip developers in the Easter region of Uganda with hands on knowledge, skills and information on how to build for a digital well being as a means of fighting unemployment amongst youths.

Target Audience

This event is targeting developers, faculties and students doing IT related courses in the region.

More details will be communicated as they unfold, RSVP now and we will keep you posted
It is free, 0 (zero) cost. Google is proud sponsor, more companies are coming on board.
how_to_find_us: You are free to reach out at +256702101481 or +256704747184

name: FlutterLive Mbale
description:
Flutter allows you to build beautiful native apps on iOS and Android from a single codebase.
At #Flutterlive #Mbale you will have the opportunity to experience flutter hands on.
We will have the following on agenda to motivate and reward your efforts to learn and use flutter.
Speaker session
Viewing session
Codelabs
Flutter developer challenge Mbale
The first three sessions are meant to help you equip your developer arsenal with more flutter knowledge and hands on experience in order to boost your participation in the challenge.

The challenge:
We love solving society challenges, we know you do too. So why not use flutter to give a useful solution on both Android and IOS and win a prize.
The challenge is open until 15th Dec 2pm. All participants in the challenge are required to submit their solutions before that time.
The winners will be announced later that day and prizes given.

Judgement Criteria:
We shall be looking at some of the things below to select the winners of the challenge.
Impact on society. The kind of flutter solution developed and the impact it will have on society.
Flutter components. The amount of flutter components in the app developed and their functions.
App Design. The app should have the best user experience and user interface developed.

The prize
1st Smartphone with data for one month
2nd Smartphone

Useful links:
Flutter
https://flutter.io
Installation
https://flutter.io/docs/get-started/install
User interface
https://flutter.io/docs/development/ui/widgets-intro
Tutorials
https://flutter.io/docs/reference/tutorials
Flutter codelabs
https://codelabs.developers.google.com/?cat=Flutter

https://www.udacity.com/course/build-native-mobile-apps-with-flutter--ud905
Or reach at to the team at Hansu office in mission, Mbale.

Submitting the solution;
Participants are required to share the links to their .apk and .ipa files through a form that will be provided. Those who will also share their github repo of the solution will have an added advantage.

The link for submission
https://goo.gl/forms/L7L0vGUVVkEqifB83

name: Android Things Mbale
description: Come join GDG Mbale for a session on Android Things, it's an Android-based embedded operating system platform by Google, announced at Google I/O. It is aimed to be used with low-power and memory constrained Internet of Things devices, which are usually built from different MCU platforms. As an IoT OS it is designed to work as low as 32–64 MB of RAM

name: TensorFlow Dev Summit Extended Mbale 2019
description:
TensorFlow Dev Summit brings together a diverse mix of machine learning users from around the world for two days of highly technical talks, demos, and conversation with the TensorFlow team and community.
Join GDG Mbale for TensorFlow Dev Summit Extended for
Hands on code labs and tech talks
It is a free to attend event just reserve a slot and you are in.
You need to come along with your laptop

name: Cloud Study Jam Mbale 2019
description:
Want to get started on the Google Cloud, but don't know where to begin? Join us for our Cloud Study Jam!
Get official Google training, a $55+ value, free of charge. Together we'll work through several Google Cloud labs. You will get hands-on experience with the Cloud Console, Kubernetes, Security, IoT on Cloud, and Machine Learning.
Then after our live session, you will have free access to more labs you can finish at home. Complete all labs in the quest and earn a Google-hosted badge for your online profile, and additional 30 days access to the training platform to compete any labs you want
Bring a laptop and charger (PC, Mac or Chromebook)! The labs will run on all of the latest versions of the popular browsers. For the best experience, make sure your laptop has Firefox or Chrome installed. Don’t forget your charger.
Whoever registers has an automatic confirmation
